headline: 2000 - E. coli O157 in Canada
main_text: The Public Health Unit for the town of Walkerton, Ontario (population 5000) has reported an outbreak of E.coli O157. To date, 5 people have died and 27 are hospitalized. Exposure to E. coli is believed to have occurred between 12-15 May. Tests have confirmedÂ  E. coli contamination in the Walkerton water supply system. On 21 May, the Public Health Unit issued a "Boil Water Order" to the residents of Walkerton which is still in effect. Investigations are underway by provincial and federal health and environmental authorities.
